humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathology report provides a T Stage of 2, and there is no information suggesting T3 or T4, so based on the rules provided, the T stage for this invasive ductal carcinoma is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. A T2 stage tumor is defined as a tumor that is greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm in size. According to the pathology report, the tumor size is not specified, but it is classified as T2. This could be because the size of the tumor was not included in the report or it was not possible to determine the size of the tumor based on the specimen provided. However, since the report specifically states T2, we can assume that the tumor size falls within this category.
